text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen it's New 
Years Eve tonight by the time you see this it will

not be New Years Eve but it's in your soup right 
now so I'm going to make a cocktail to celebrate

the year 2015 but it is a cocktail that is perfect 
for any occasion even when you're sitting at home

by yourself it's a Thai coffee cocktail which 
is I particularly love it I've been wanting to

do this for a long time and now is the opportune 
moment super super simple start out obviously Thai

coffee now if you're not familiar with Thai coffee 
have a whole episode in fact about two episodes on

Thai coffee but quickly it's comes in the back 
like this a lot of times it'll say only young

all young is our word for Thai black coffee and I 
brew this anti coffee is coffee plus some roasted

corn and soy beans as well so it's got a different 
smoky flavor and I brewed this four tablespoons to

a cup so it's super super dark as Thai coffee 
is generally super super dark so I've chilled

it down and I've got two ounces Luzi how dark 
that is I love the smell and then to this I'm

adding some Kahlua just an ounce I don't I'm a 
little bit different when it comes to alcohol

so if you want it stronger you might want to go 
more cut more Kahlua than than this but this is

this is good enough for me ice of course lots and 
lots of ice that a quick stir and pour that over

okay so now if you're familiar with Thai 
iced coffee it usually gets a drizzle of

evaporated milk and it does this beautiful 
cascade down into the black of the coffee

and so there's the perfect liquor to 
do that and that is Bailey's or any

Irish Cream Liqueur and I just like 
to pour it over the back of the spoon

I feel like a Thai coffee without 
condensed milk is not really a Thai

coffee so I made a little drizzle 
and this is basically condensed milk

mixed with a lot of cocoa powder to get it 
really dark with a splash of Thai coffee

so you serve this with a straw so 
people can kind of stir around it
and you can just watch the the cool mixing effect

mmm my god it's like dessert and a drink and a 
coffee it's like all the good things in life in

one glass it's so good so happy new year 2015 to 
all of hot pie kitchen fans and the recipe for

this is on hotty kitchen calm and when you make 
this send me a photo Facebook Twitter Instagram

I am available on all of those platforms and I 
will see you next time for another yummy drink
